meanings.definition: Become fully aware of (something) as a fact; understand clearly.
meanings.sent1: She realises the importance of studying for the test.
meanings.sent2: He finally realises that honesty is the best policy.
meanings.sent3: The student realises they forgot their homework at home.
meanings.sent4: As the sun sets, she realises the day is coming to an end.
meanings.sent5: In the silence of the library, he realises the weight of his responsibilities.

meanings.sent1: The artist realises her vision on the canvas.
meanings.sent2: Through hard work, he realises his dream of owning a business.
meanings.sent3: The magician realises a rabbit out of the hat.
meanings.sent4: With each brushstroke, she realises a beautiful masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: In his imagination, he realises a world filled with magic and wonder.

meanings.definition: Cause (something desired or anticipated) to happen.
meanings.sent1: Her determination realises success in her career.
meanings.sent2: The team effort realises a victory in the championship.
meanings.sent3: The wish upon a shooting star realises a new beginning.
meanings.sent4: Through hard work, he realises his goal of running a marathon.
meanings.sent5: With each step forward, she realises her dream of traveling the world.
